entry.title: Firefighters' pension scheme: employee contributions
entry.summary: A consultation on the proposed changes to the firefighters' pension schemes in England.
entry.content:
The proposed changes to the firefighters’ pension schemes in England are:

  • increased levels of employee contribution rates, effective from 1 April 2012
  • the introduction of tiered contribution levels, so that higher earners will pay a higher rate of contribution
  • different levels of increase for the firefighters’ pension scheme (1992) and new firefighters’ pension scheme (2006)
  • the specific handling of contributions for retained and part-time firefighters

entry.title: Amendments to the new firefighters' pension scheme 2006: automatic enrolment
entry.summary: Consultation about amendments to firefighters' pensions, to comply with pension reforms on automatic enrolment.
entry.content:
This consultation covers amendments to the new firefighters’ pension scheme (England), as set out in the Firefighters’ Pension Scheme (England) Order 2006.

This is so that fire and rescue authorities can comply with their duties for automatic enrolment under workplace pension reform.

entry.title: Protocol on government intervention action on fire and rescue authorities in England
entry.summary: Consultation about revising the protocol on government intervention action for fire and rescue authorities in England.
entry.content:
Consultation on guidance on statements of assurance for fire and rescue authorities in England and Protocol on Government intervention action for fire and rescue authorities in England.

The consultation seeks views on the revision of the protocol on Government intervention action and applies to fire and rescue authorities in England only.

entry.title: Reducing annual returns and 'fires of special interest' data from fire and rescue authorities
entry.content: The statistical consultation seeks the views on a reduction in non-financial annual returns from fire and rescue authorities and fires of special interest reporting.

entry.title: The future of fire and rescue control services in England
entry.content: This consultation seeks the views from the fire and rescue sector on the future arrangements of fire and rescue control services in England following the decision to close down the FiReControl project.

entry.title: Firefighters' pension scheme
entry.content:
This consultation sets out a number of proposed changes to the firefighters’ pension scheme and new firefighters’ pension scheme.

It includes the following key proposals:

  • the removal of rule A14, compulsory retirement on the grounds of efficiency
  • changes to the indexation of additional pension benefits
  • changes to the maximum communtation payment
  • proposals to deal with potential age discrimination
  • amendments to the medical and non-medical appeals processes
  • abatement of pensions
  • technical amendments and alignments with tax legislation

entry.title: Distribution of fire capital grant
entry.content: This consultation seeks views from the fire and rescue authorities on the distribution of the capital grant funding.

entry.title: Fire and rescue national framework for England
entry.content:
The draft national framework sets out the priorities and objectives for fire and rescue authorities in England in connection with the discharge of their functions.

Clearly setting out the role of fire and rescue authorities in delivering national resilience, the draft national framework sets out how they will work individually, collectively and with government to ensure capacity is in place to respond to major incidents.

entry.title: Changing the name of Bedfordshire and Luton combined fire authority
entry.content: This consultation seeks views from selected bodies on the proposal of Bedfordshire and Luton Combined Fire Authority to change their name to Bedfordshire Fire and Rescue Authority.
